arm_group.description: Any surgically treated patient with a functional lung resection (at least wedge resection)

brief_summary.textblock: Retrospective analysis of surgery and/or bronchial embolisation for pulmonary aspergilloma.

clinical_study.brief_title: Outcome After Treatment of Pulmonary Aspergilloma

detailed_description.textblock:
A retrospective chart analysis, based on the search results from a thoracic surgery database
      and an interventional radiology database. Outcome analysis of all surgically treated
      patients for a confirmed invasive aspergilloma. Comparisson with (preoperative) embolisation
      of the bronchial circulation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Histological proven Aspergilloma of the lung

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Treatment limited to the use of systemic antifungal agents

study_pop.textblock:
All patients in the database with following interventions will be screened for invasive
        aspergilloma in the final resection specimen:

        Aspergilloma Fungal disease Lung bleeding Destroyed lung Empyema of the lung

clinical_study.official_title: Outcome After Surgical Treatment or Bronchial Embolisation in Aspergilloma of the Lung: a Single Center Experience.

oversight_info.authority: Belgium: Federal Agency for Medicines and Health Products, FAMHP

primary_outcome.description: estimated 10 yaer survival after treatment for pulmonary aspergilloma

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: survival status at 90 days after initiation of treatment

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Retrospective
